plugin.name: General Information
plugin.description: General details on the infrastructure
plugin.author: Alan Renouf, Frederic Martin

plugin.name: Checking VI Events
plugin.description: The following errors were logged in the vCenter Events tab, you may wish to investigate these
plugin.author: Alan Renouf

plugin.name: VC Services
plugin.description: The following vCenter Services are not in the required state
plugin.author: Alan Renouf

plugin.name: Windows vCenter Error Event Logs
plugin.description: The following errors were found in the vCenter Event Logs, you may wish to check these further
plugin.author: Alan Renouf
plugin.href: https://raw.github.com/alanrenouf/vCheck-vSphere/master/Plugins/10 vCenter/42 Windows vCenter Error Event Logs.ps1

plugin.name: Windows vCenter Warning Event Logs
plugin.description: The following warnings were found in the vCenter Event Logs, you may wish to check these further
plugin.author: Alan Renouf
plugin.href: https://raw.github.com/alanrenouf/vCheck-vSphere/master/Plugins/10 vCenter/43 Windows vCenter Warning Event Logs.ps1

plugin.name: vCenter License Report
plugin.description: The following displays licenses registered with this server and usage.
plugin.author: Justin Mercier

plugin.name: HA configuration issues
plugin.description: The following clusters have HA configuration issues. This will impact your disaster recovery.
plugin.author: John Sneddon

plugin.name: Clusters Without Host Profile attached
plugin.description: The following clusters do not have a host profile attached
plugin.author: John Sneddon
plugin.href: https://raw.github.com/alanrenouf/vCheck-vSphere/master/Plugins/20 Cluster/104 Clusters with no Host Profile.ps1

plugin.name: HA VMs restarted
plugin.description: The following VMs have been restarted by HA in the last $HAVMresetold days
plugin.author: Alan Renouf

plugin.name: DRS & SDRS Migrations
plugin.description: Multiple DRS Migrations may be an indication of overloaded hosts, check resource levels of the cluster
plugin.author: Alan Renouf, Jonathan Medd

plugin.name: Cluster Slot Sizes
plugin.description: Slot sizes in the below cluster are less than is specified, this may cause issues with creating new VMs, for more information click here: Yellow-Bricks HA Deep Dive
plugin.author: Alan Renouf

plugin.name: Cluster Configuration Issues
plugin.description: The following alarms have been registered against clusters in vCenter
plugin.author: Alan Renouf

plugin.name: Datastore Consistency
plugin.description: Virtual Machines residing on these datastores will not be able to run on all hosts in the cluster
plugin.author: Robert Sexstone

plugin.name: Clusters with DRS disabled
plugin.description: The following clusters have DRS disabled. This may impact the performance of your cluster.
plugin.author: Robert van den Nieuwendijk

plugin.name: Cluster Node version
plugin.description: Display per cluster nodes version if unique or mismatch
plugin.author: Raphael Schitz, Frederic Martin

plugin.name: QuickStats Capacity Planning
plugin.description: The following gives brief capacity information for each cluster based on QuickStats CPU/Mem usage and counting for HA failover requirements
plugin.author: Raphael Schitz, Frederic Martin

plugin.name: s/vMotion Information
plugin.description: s/vMotions and how long they took to migrate between hosts and datastores
plugin.author: Alan Renouf

plugin.name: More RAM than free space on Datastore
plugin.description: The following VMs can't vMotion because they have more RAM than free space on datastore
plugin.author: Olivier TABUT, Bob Cote
plugin.href: https://raw.github.com/alanrenouf/vCheck-vSphere/master/Plugins/20 Cluster/73 VM - More RAM than free space on Datastore.ps1

plugin.name: DRS Rules
plugin.description: Contains all DRS rules defined in this vCenter - {0}
plugin.author: John Sneddon

plugin.name: Hosts Overcommit state
plugin.description: Overcommitted hosts may cause issues with performance if memory is not issued when needed, this may cause ballooning and swapping
plugin.author: Alan Renouf

plugin.name: Hosts Dead LUN Path
plugin.description: Dead LUN Paths may cause issues with storage performance or be an indication of loss of redundancy
plugin.author: Alan Renouf, Frederic Martin

plugin.name: ESXi Inode Exhaustion
plugin.description: The following hosts have an excessive amount of Inodes in use on the local ESXi filesystem. This can cause hosts to disconnect from vCenter and becoming completely unmanageable even locally, requiring a hard reboot. See <a href=`
plugin.author: Matthias Koehler

plugin.name: Host Profile Compliance
plugin.description: Failures
plugin.author: John Sneddon

plugin.name: Hosts with Upcoming Certificate Expiration
plugin.description: The following hosts have certificates that will expire soon and will need to be replaced.

plugin.name: Host Swapfile datastores
plugin.description: The following hosts are in a cluster which is set to store the swap file in the datastore specified by the host but no location has been set on the host
plugin.author: Alan Renouf

plugin.name: ESXi with Technical Support mode or ESXi Shell enabled
plugin.description: The following ESXi Hosts have Technical support mode or ESXi Shell enabled, this may not be the best security option, see here for more information: Yellow-Bricks Disable Tech Support on ESXi.
plugin.author: Alan Renouf
plugin.href: https://raw.github.com/alanrenouf/vCheck-vSphere/master/Plugins/30 Host/20 ESXi with Technical Support mode enabled.ps1

plugin.name: ESXi hosts which do not have Lockdown mode enabled
plugin.description: The following ESXi Hosts do not have lockdown enabled, think about using lockdown as an extra security feature.
plugin.author: Alan Renouf
plugin.href: https://raw.github.com/alanrenouf/vCheck-vSphere/master/Plugins/30 Host/21 ESXi hosts which do not have Lockdown mode enabled.ps1

plugin.name: NTP Name and Service
plugin.description: The following hosts do not have the correct NTP settings and may cause issues if the time becomes far apart from the vCenter/Domain or other hosts
plugin.author: Alan Renouf

plugin.name: Host Configuration Issues
plugin.description: The following configuration issues have been registered against Hosts in vCenter
plugin.author: Alan Renouf

plugin.name: Host Alarms
plugin.description: The following alarms have been registered against hosts in vCenter
plugin.author: Alan Renouf, John Sneddon

plugin.name: VMKernel Warnings
plugin.description: The following VMKernel issues were found, it is suggested all unknown issues are explored on the VMware Knowledge Base. Use the below links to automatically search for the string
plugin.author: Alan Renouf, Frederic Martin

plugin.name: Missing ESX(i) updates and patches
plugin.description: KB
plugin.author: Luc Dekens

plugin.name: Syslog Name
plugin.description: The following hosts do not have the correct Syslog settings which may cause issues if ESXi hosts experience issues and logs need to be investigated
plugin.author: Jonathan Medd

plugin.name: Hardware status warnings/errors
plugin.description: Details can be found in the Hardware Status tab
plugin.author: Raphael Schitz

plugin.name: Hosts with reboot required
plugin.description: The following hosts require a reboot.
plugin.author: Robert van den Nieuwendijk

plugin.name: Host Build versions in use
plugin.description: The following host builds are in use in this vCenter
plugin.author: Frederic Martin

plugin.name: Network redundancy lost
plugin.description: The following Hosts have lost network redundancy
plugin.author: Olivier TABUT

plugin.name: Hosts with different hostname
plugin.description: The following hosts have a different hostname than their name in the vCenter Server. This might give troubles with HA.
plugin.author: Robert van den Nieuwendijk

plugin.name: Lost Access to Volume
plugin.description: The following hosts have lost access to a volume. This may indicate a problem with your storage solution.
plugin.author: Robert van den Nieuwendijk, Jonathan Medd

plugin.name: Check LUNS have the recommended number of paths
plugin.description: Not enough storage paths can effect storage availability in a FC SAN environment
plugin.author: Craig Smith

plugin.name: Hosts not Connected or Alarms Disabled
plugin.description: Shows hosts not in service and those with alarms disabled.

plugin.href: https://raw.github.com/alanrenouf/vCheck-vSphere/master/Plugins/30 Host/83 Hosts not Connected or Alarms Disabled.ps1

plugin.name: Datastore Information
plugin.description: Datastores which run out of space will cause impact on the virtual machines held on these datastores

plugin.description: The following Datastore Clusters either do not have sDRS enabled or it is set to manual

plugin.name: Number of VMs per Datastore
plugin.description: The Maximum number of VMs per datastore is 256, the following VMs are above the defined $NumVMsPerDatastore and may cause performance issues
plugin.author: Alan Renouf, Frederic Martin
plugin.href: https://raw.github.com/alanrenouf/vCheck-vSphere/master/Plugins/40 Datastore/34 Number of VMs per Datastore.ps1

plugin.name: Datastore OverAllocation
plugin.description: The following datastores may be overcommitted, it is strongly suggested you check these

plugin.name: Datastores with Storage IO Control Disabled
plugin.description: Datastores with Storage I/O Control Disabled can impact the performance of your virtual machines.

plugin.name: Checking Standard vSwitch Ports Free

plugin.author: Kyle Ruddy
plugin.href: https://raw.github.com/alanrenouf/vCheck-vSphere/master/Plugins/50 Network/80 DvPG with less than x Ports Free.ps1

plugin.name: vSwitch Security
plugin.description: All security options for standard vSwitches should be set to REJECT. Distributed vSwitches may require ForgedTrasmits in the default portgroup but should be disabled in other VM Network portgroups unless expressly required.
plugin.author: Justin Mercier, Sam McGeown, John Sneddon

plugin.name: Map disk region event
plugin.description: These may occur due to VCB issues, check this article for more details
plugin.author: Alan Renouf

plugin.name: Created or cloned VMs
plugin.description: The following VMs have been created over the last {0} Days
plugin.author: Alan Renouf

plugin.name: Removed VMs
plugin.description: The following VMs have been removed/deleted over the last $($VMsNewRemovedAge) days
plugin.author: Alan Renouf

plugin.name: VMs with CPU or Memory Reservations Configured
plugin.description: The following VMs have a CPU or Memory Reservation configured which may impact the performance of the VM. Note: -1 indicates no reservation
plugin.author: Dan Jellesma
plugin.href: https://raw.github.com/alanrenouf/vCheck-vSphere/master/Plugins/60 VM/100 VMs with CPU or Memory Reservations.ps1

plugin.name: VM Logging
plugin.description: The following virtual machines are not configured to rotate logs at $RotateSize bytes and/or to store $KeepOld logs.
plugin.author: Bob Cote

plugin.name: CPU/Mem HotPlug
plugin.description: VMs needs to be shutdown to modify CPU/Mem HotPlug in case this settings is disabled.
plugin.author: Eric Lannier
plugin.href: https://raw.github.com/alanrenouf/vCheck-vSphere/master/Plugins/60 VM/103 VMs CPU MEM Add Hot Disabled.ps1

plugin.name: Find Phantom Snapshots
plugin.description: The following VM's have Phantom Snapshots
plugin.author: Mads Fog Albrechtslund

plugin.name: Quantity of snapshots
plugin.description: The following VMs have more than $MaxNumberSnapshots snapshot(s)
plugin.author: Mads Fog Albrechtslund

plugin.name: VMs with over $vCPU vCPUs
plugin.description: The following VMs have over $vCPU CPU(s) and may impact performance due to CPU scheduling
plugin.author: Alan Renouf
plugin.href: https://raw.github.com/alanrenouf/vCheck-vSphere/master/Plugins/60 VM/11 VMs with over CPU Count.ps1

plugin.name: VM Tools Not Up to Date
plugin.description: The following VMs are running an older version of Tools than is available on its Host (Max Shown: $VMTMaxReturn Exceptions: $VMTDoNotInclude)
plugin.author: Alan Renouf, Shawn Masterson
plugin.href: https://raw.github.com/alanrenouf/vCheck-vSphere/master/Plugins/60 VM/114 VM Tools Not Up to Date.ps1

plugin.name: VMs Ballooning or Swapping
plugin.description: Ballooning and swapping may indicate a lack of memory or a limit on a VM, this may be an indication of not enough memory in a host or a limit held on a VM, further information is available here.
plugin.author: Alan Renouf, Frederic Martin

plugin.name: Invalid or inaccessible VM
plugin.description: The following VMs are marked as inaccessible or invalid
plugin.author: Alan Renouf

plugin.name: VMs restarted due to Guest OS Error
plugin.description: The following VMs have been restarted by HA in the last $HAVMresetold days
plugin.author: Alan Renouf
plugin.href: https://raw.github.com/alanrenouf/vCheck-vSphere/master/Plugins/60 VM/14 VMs restarted due to Guest OS Error.ps1

plugin.name: Guests with less than $MBFree MB
plugin.description: The following guests have less than $MBFree MB Free, if a guest disk fills up it may cause issues with the guest Operating System
plugin.author: Alan Renouf
plugin.href: https://raw.github.com/alanrenouf/vCheck-vSphere/master/Plugins/60 VM/19 Guests with less than X MB free.ps1

plugin.name: Checking VM Hardware Version
plugin.description: The following VMs are not at the latest hardware version, you may gain performance enhancements if you convert them to the latest version
plugin.author: Alan Renouf

plugin.name: VMs in inconsistent folders
plugin.description: The following VMs are not stored in folders consistent to their names, this may cause issues when trying to locate them from the datastore manually
plugin.author: Alan Renouf

plugin.name: No VM Tools
plugin.description: The following VMs have No VMTools installed, for optimal configuration and performance these should be installed
plugin.author: Alan Renouf

plugin.name: VM Tools Issues
plugin.description: The following VMs have issues with VMTools, these should be checked and reinstalled if necessary
plugin.author: Alan Renouf

plugin.name: CD-ROMs Connected
plugin.description: The following VMs have a CD-ROM connected, this may cause issues if this machine needs to be migrated to a different host
plugin.author: Alan Renouf, Frederic Martin

plugin.name: Floppies Connected
plugin.description: The following VMs have a floppy drive connected, this may cause issues if this machine needs to be migrated to a different host
plugin.author: Alan Renouf, Frederic Martin

plugin.name: Single Storage VMs
plugin.description: The following VMs are located on storage which is only accessible by 1 host, these will not be compatible with vMotion and may be disconnected in the event of host failure
plugin.author: Alan Renouf, Frederic Martin

plugin.name: VM CPU %RDY
plugin.description: The following VMs have high CPU RDY times, this can cause performance issues for more information please read This article
plugin.author: Alan Renouf

plugin.name: VM Alarms
plugin.description: The following alarms have been registered against VMs in vCenter
plugin.author: Alan Renouf

plugin.name: VCB/Veeam/NetBackup Garbage
plugin.description: The following snapshots have been left over from using VCB/Veeam or Netbackup, you may wish to investigate if these are still needed
plugin.author: Alan Renouf, Frederic Martin

plugin.name: VMs needing snapshot consolidation
plugin.description: The following VMs have snapshots that failed to consolidate. See this article for more details
plugin.author: Luc Dekens, Frederic Martin

plugin.name: Find VMs with thick or thin provisioned vmdk
plugin.description: The following VMs have have $diskformat provisioned vmdk(s)
plugin.author: David Chung

plugin.name: VMs with CPU or Memory Limits Configured
plugin.description: The following VMs have a CPU or memory limit configured which may impact the performance of the VM. Note: -1 indicates no limit
plugin.author: Jonathan Medd
plugin.href: https://raw.github.com/alanrenouf/vCheck-vSphere/master/Plugins/60 VM/50 VMs with CPU or Memory Limits Configured.ps1

plugin.name: Virtual machines with incorrect OS configuration
plugin.description: The following virtual machines have an installed OS that is different from the configured OS. This can impact the performance of the virtual machine.
plugin.author: Robert van den Nieuwendijk
plugin.href: https://raw.github.com/alanrenouf/vCheck-vSphere/master/Plugins/60 VM/54 Virtual Machines with incorrect OS Configuration.ps1

plugin.name: Virtual machines with less hard disks than partitions
plugin.description: Virtual machines with less hard disks than partitions. Probably they have more than one partition on a hard disk.
plugin.author: Robert van den Nieuwendijk
plugin.href: https://raw.github.com/alanrenouf/vCheck-vSphere/master/Plugins/60 VM/58 Virtual machines with less hard disks than partitions.ps1

plugin.name: Powered Off VMs
plugin.description: May want to consider deleting VMs that have been powered off for more than 30 days
plugin.author: Adam Schwartzberg

plugin.name: VMs by Operating System
plugin.description: The following Operating Systems are in use in this vCenter
plugin.author: Raymond

plugin.name: Unwanted virtual hardware found
plugin.description: Certain kinds of hardware are unwanted on virtual machines as they may cause unnecessary vMotion constraints.
plugin.author: Frederic Martin

plugin.name: VM - Display all VMs with CBT not enabled
plugin.description: List all VMs with CBT status disabled. It's not a good option for backup!
plugin.author: Cyril Epiney

plugin.name: Snapshots Oversize
plugin.description: VMware snapshots which are kept for a long period of time may cause issues, filling up datastores and also may impact performance of the virtual machine.
plugin.author: Raphael Schitz, Shawn Masterson

plugin.name: Mis-named virtual machines
plugin.description: The following guest names do not match the name inside of the guest.
plugin.author: Frederic Martin

plugin.name: VM - is my network connected?
plugin.description: Check if all network cards are connected
plugin.author: Cyril Epiney

plugin.name: Reset VMs
plugin.description: The following VMs have been reset over the last $($VMsResetAge) days
plugin.author: James Scholefield

plugin.name: VMs in uncontrolled snapshot mode
plugin.description: The following VMs are in snapshot mode, but vCenter isn't aware of it. See http://kb.vmware.com/kb/1002310
plugin.author: Rick Glover, Matthias Koehler
plugin.href: https://raw.github.com/alanrenouf/vCheck-vSphere/master/Plugins/60 VM/79 Find VMs in Uncontrolled Snapshot Mode.ps1

plugin.name: Snapshot activity
plugin.description: TaskEvent
plugin.author: Chris Monahan, but is a minor mod of two plugins by Raphael Schitz and Frederic Martin

plugin.name: Site Recovery Manager - RPO Violation Report
plugin.description: This is a customizable report of RPO violations found in the vCenter event log.
plugin.author: Joel Gibson, based on work by Alan Renouf

plugin.name: Disconnecting from vCenter
plugin.description: Disconnect plugin
plugin.author: Alan Renouf
